item.title: Boise State University
item.description: Idaho's metropolitan research university, Boise State offers over 200 graduate and undergraduate degrees in the stateâs political, business and cultural center.

item.title: California State University-Fresno
item.description: Official site for California State University, Fresno. Home of the Fresno State Bulldogs.

item.title: Colorado State University-Fort Collins
item.description: Colorado State University is an accredited, public, four-year, comprehensive research university located in Fort Collins. CSU offers bachelors, masters and doctorate degrees from its colleges and areas of study.

item.title: University of Nevada-Reno
item.description: The University of Nevada, Reno was founded in 1874 and offers degrees in the undergraduate, graduate and doctoral levels.

item.title: Utah State University
item.description: Founded in 1888, Utah State University is Utah’s only land grant institution, offering 168 undergraduate degrees, 143 graduate degrees and serving over 28,000 students in Logan and around the state at Distance Education campuses and learning centers, as well as at USU Eastern. Known for its robust and cutting edge research, Utah State challenges students to pursue academic opportunities that will change the world.
